bibl.title: Letter from Lucian C. Smith to Henry Rose Carter, September 29, 1924

div1.p: Smith explains that there was typing error made in the prior report concerning the first appearance of yellow fever in Ceara, Brazil.

div1.head: Letter from Lucian C. Smith to Henry Rose Carter, September 29, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
RUA D. PEDRO N. 107
CAIXA POSTAL, N. 57
DEPARTAMENTO DE SAÚDE PUBLICA
COMMISSÃO DA FEBRE AMARELLA
FORTALEZA-CEARÁ
BRAZIL September 29, 1924
END. TELEG. INTERCOM.
TELEPHONE N.
Brazil
Peryossu
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
A letter has just been received from Dr. Peryassúin
answer to my request, at your suggestion, for his authority for the data
he furnished on the history of yellow fever in the interior of the State of
Ceará, and I am inclosing a copy to you together with certain memoranda
which he forwarded with his communication. Upon review it is evident, as
he points out, that an error in typing accounted for his statement, as it
appeared in his “observations” in the paper that he submitted, that the
disease first showed in the towns of Icó and Iguatú in 1652. In the tab-
ulated portion of his report the date is given as 1852 for Icó and Iguatú
and 1874 for Lavras.

I must confess that a more careful examination of his
report in this office probably would have avoided the transmission of a
palpable mistake. However, the statement as to endemicity from then on
does not seem to me to be satisfactorily explained. Perhaps I had better
pass that as you will compare the verbatim quotation from the report with
the memorandum herewith inclosed. I do not mean to be critical to any
further extent than is necessary to reach a correction.

In this connection I thought that it might interest you
to review a report of a speech recently made by Dr. Gavião Gonzaga, chief
of the Saneamento Rural of the State of Ceará, at a meeting of the Medical
Society of Rio de Janeiro on the history of yellow fever in this state. The
inclosure is a translation made in this office.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely and respectfully, Lucian C Smith Dr. H. R. Carter,
The Westmoreland, No. 2122 California Street,
Washington, D. C., U. S. A.
